BandSpec.description: Band specification for technical indicators. IMPORTANT: 'length' is in BARS, not days. Effective lookback horizon = tf × length (e.g., 720 bars × 1h ≈ 30 days, 24 bars × 1h ≈ 1 day). Maximum length is 400 bars. When user says 'N days', convert to bars: days × (bars_per_day for tf). For 1h: 1 day = 24 bars, 30 days = 720 bars (max ~16.7 days on 1h timeframe).

length.description: Number of BARS for the lookback window (NOT days). Maximum: 400 bars. Effective horizon = tf × length. Examples: 24 bars × 1h ≈ 1 day, 400 bars × 1h ≈ 16.7 days. To convert user's 'days' to bars: days × (bars_per_day for tf). For 1h: 1 day = 24 bars, 16.7 days = 400 bars (maximum).

mult.description: Standard deviation multiplier for band width. Values >2 are rare events, >2.5 are very rare, >3 are extreme/dramatic outliers.

oneOf.title: Distance from mean via z or band-multiple

XSRankSpec.description: [MVP-EXCLUDED] Cross-sectional ranking specification for portfolio entry/exit. Ranks symbols by feature and selects top/bottom N for long/short positions. Not available in MVP (single-asset trading only).

rank_feature.description: Feature to rank by: ret_1d (1-day return), ret_1w (1-week return), hv_ratio (historical volatility ratio), rsi (RSI), ema_slope (EMA slope).

top_n.description: Number of top-ranked symbols to select for long positions. Rank is 1-based (1 = highest rank, lower = stronger).

bottom_n.description: Number of bottom-ranked symbols to select for short positions (when side='long_short'). If omitted and side='long_short', defaults to top_n. Set to 0 or omit for long_only strategies.

rebalance_cadence.description: How often to rebalance the portfolio: 1d (daily) or 1w (weekly).

weights.description: Position sizing: equal (equal weight) or rank (weight by rank, higher rank = larger position).

side.description: Position direction: long_only (only long top N) or long_short (long top N, short bottom N).

PairsSpec.description: [MVP-EXCLUDED] Pairs trading specification for spread trading between two symbols. Not available in MVP (single-asset trading only).

IntermarketSpec.description: Intermarket trigger specification for MVP single-asset trading. Supports single leader (via leader_symbol) or multiple leaders (via leaders array with aggregation). MVP CONSTRAINT: follower_symbol MUST equal context.symbol (the only traded symbol). Leader symbols are observation-only triggers.

leaders.description: Array of leader symbols for basket-based triggers (e.g., ['BTC-USD', 'ETH-USD']). Use with leader_aggregate. Mutually exclusive with leader_symbol.

leader_symbol.description: Single leader symbol (backward compatibility). Mutually exclusive with leaders array.

leader_aggregate.description: Aggregation rule for multi-leader triggers. Required when using leaders array.

feature.description: Feature to compute for each leader (same as trigger_feature for single leader).

op.description: Aggregation operator: max (trigger if any leader exceeds threshold), min (trigger if all leaders exceed threshold), avg (trigger if average exceeds threshold).

threshold.description: Threshold for aggregated feature (same semantics as trigger_threshold for single leader).

follower_symbol.description: Symbol to trade when leader(s) trigger. Should match context.symbol for clarity (see slot_hints).

trigger_feature.description: Feature to monitor on leader (for single-leader mode). Mutually exclusive with leader_aggregate.

trigger_threshold.description: Threshold for trigger_feature (for single-leader mode). Mutually exclusive with leader_aggregate.

window_bars.description: Lookback window in bars for trigger detection.

entry_side_map.description: Mapping from leader move direction to follower entry side. For multi-leader, applies to aggregated direction (positive = up, negative = down).

leader_up.description: Follower entry when leader(s) move up (or aggregated value is positive).

leader_down.description: Follower entry when leader(s) move down (or aggregated value is negative).

SessionSpec.description: Session and time window specification. For gap conditions, use ConditionSpec with RegimeSpec.metric='gap_pct'. For confirmation, use action.confirm.

window.description: Time window for session trading. References canonical TimeWindowSpec.

RegimeSpec.description: Regime detection specification for gates, overlays, and rule-based entries. Defines a condition on trend, volatility, return, gap, VWAP distance, or derived regime classifications. Supports cross-symbol regime checks via optional symbol override.

symbol.description: Optional: symbol to evaluate the regime on. If omitted, uses context.symbol. MVP CONSTRAINT: This is for observation-only (e.g., 'If ETH is gapping up, buy BTC' → context.symbol='BTC-USD' is the ONLY traded symbol, RegimeSpec.symbol='ETH-USD' is observation-only). The symbol specified here is NOT traded - only context.symbol is traded.

metric.description: Regime metric type: trend_ma_relation (spread of fast MA - slow MA, positive = uptrend), trend_adx (Average Directional Index, >25 = strong trend), trend_regime (derived classification: 'up', 'down', 'range'), vol_bb_width_pctile (percentile rank of BB width vs lookback), vol_atr_pct (ATR as % of price), vol_regime (derived classification: 'quiet', 'normal', 'high'), ret_pct (N-bar percentage return, controlled by lookback_bars), gap_pct (percentage gap from prior close, typically used with session_phase), dist_from_vwap_pct (distance from anchored VWAP as percentage, requires vwap_anchor), session_phase (session window classification: 'open', 'close', 'overnight', requires session), risk_event_prob (probability of risk events), price_level_touch (price touches a specified level, requires level_price or level_reference), price_level_cross (price crosses a specified level, requires level_price or level_reference and direction), liquidity_sweep (detects break-below-then-reclaim pattern for stop hunts, requires level_reference and reclaim_within_bars), flag_pattern (detects flag consolidation pattern: initial momentum + narrowing range + breakout continuation, requires flag_momentum_bars, flag_consolidation_bars, flag_breakout_direction), pennant_pattern (detects pennant consolidation pattern: initial momentum + triangular narrowing + breakout continuation, requires pennant_momentum_bars, pennant_consolidation_bars, pennant_breakout_direction), volume_pctile (percentile rank of volume vs lookback), volume_spike (volume exceeds threshold, requires volume_threshold_pctile), volume_dip (volume below threshold, requires volume_threshold_pctile).

tf.description: Timeframe for regime metric calculation. Not required for session_phase or gap_pct (session-based).

op.description: Comparison operator. Use 'between' with value and value_hi for range checks. Use '==' or '!=' for trend_regime, vol_regime, and session_phase (string comparisons).

oneOf.description: Threshold value for numeric comparisons. For 'between', this is the lower bound.
String value for regime/session comparisons (e.g., 'up', 'quiet', 'open'). Used with trend_regime, vol_regime, or session_phase metrics.

value_hi.description: Upper bound for 'between' operator (required when op='between' for numeric metrics).

lookback_bars.description: Lookback window in bars for percentile/metric calculation. For ret_pct, this controls the N-bar return period (e.g., lookback_bars=1 for 1-bar return, lookback_bars=24 for 24-bar return on 1h timeframe ≈ 1 day). For vol_bb_width_pctile, this is the lookback for percentile calculation.

ma_fast.description: Fast moving average period (required for trend_ma_relation metric).

ma_slow.description: Slow moving average period (required for trend_ma_relation metric).

vwap_anchor.description: VWAP anchor specification (required for dist_from_vwap_pct metric).

session.description: Trading session (required for session_phase and gap_pct metrics).

trend_threshold.description: Threshold for trend_regime classification. If omitted, uses default thresholds (ma_fast/ma_slow spread > 0.5% = 'up', < -0.5% = 'down', else 'range').

vol_threshold_low.description: Lower threshold for vol_regime classification (percentile). If omitted, uses default thresholds (pctile < 25 = 'quiet', pctile > 75 = 'high', else 'normal').

vol_threshold_high.description: Upper threshold for vol_regime classification (percentile). If omitted, uses default thresholds (pctile < 25 = 'quiet', pctile > 75 = 'high', else 'normal').

level_price.description: Fixed price level for price_level_touch or price_level_cross metrics. Use this OR level_reference (not both). Required when metric is price_level_touch or price_level_cross and level_reference is not provided.

level_reference.description: Dynamic level reference for price_level_touch, price_level_cross, or liquidity_sweep metrics. Use this OR level_price (not both). 'previous_low'/'previous_high' = lowest/highest price in lookback_bars. 'recent_support'/'recent_resistance' = support/resistance level detected in lookback_bars. 'session_low'/'session_high' = lowest/highest price in current session (requires session). Required when metric is liquidity_sweep or when using dynamic levels with price_level_touch/price_level_cross.

level_direction.description: Direction for price_level_cross metric: 'up' means price crosses above level, 'down' means price crosses below level. Required when metric is price_level_cross.

reclaim_within_bars.description: For liquidity_sweep metric: maximum bars allowed between break-below and reclaim. Required when metric is liquidity_sweep.

flag_momentum_bars.description: For flag_pattern metric: lookback bars to detect initial momentum move. Required when metric is flag_pattern.

flag_consolidation_bars.description: For flag_pattern metric: bars to detect consolidation period with narrowing range. Required when metric is flag_pattern.

flag_breakout_direction.description: For flag_pattern metric: expected breakout direction. 'same' means continuation in direction of initial momentum. Required when metric is flag_pattern.

pennant_momentum_bars.description: For pennant_pattern metric: lookback bars to detect initial momentum move. Required when metric is pennant_pattern.

pennant_consolidation_bars.description: For pennant_pattern metric: bars to detect triangular consolidation period. Required when metric is pennant_pattern.

pennant_breakout_direction.description: For pennant_pattern metric: expected breakout direction. 'same' means continuation in direction of initial momentum. Required when metric is pennant_pattern.

volume_threshold_pctile.description: Volume percentile threshold for volume_spike (e.g., 90 = top 10% of volume) or volume_dip (e.g., 10 = bottom 10% of volume). Required when metric is volume_spike or volume_dip.

notes.description: Optional notes about this regime condition.

ExecutionSpec.description: Execution instructions for placing an order. Purely how to execute, not why.

limit_price.description: Absolute limit price. Required when order_type is limit or stop_limit unless limit_offset_pct is provided.

limit_offset_pct.description: Limit price as an offset percent from the reference price at order time. Example: -0.2 means 0.2% below reference.

stop_price.description: Absolute stop trigger price. Required when order_type is stop or stop_limit.

slippage_bps.description: Optional: assumed slippage in basis points for backtests/sims when order_type=market.

trailing_limit.description: Trailing limit order configuration. When enabled, the limit price trails behind the current price (for buys) or ahead of the current price (for sells) by a specified offset. Useful for 'trailing buy' or 'trailing sell' strategies.

enabled.description: Enable trailing limit behavior. When true, limit_price or limit_offset_pct becomes a trailing offset that updates with price movement.

trail_offset_pct.description: Trailing offset as percentage. For buy orders, limit trails below current price by this %. For sell orders, limit trails above current price by this %. Required when trailing_limit.enabled=true.

update_frequency.description: How often to update the trailing limit price: 'tick' (every price update), 'bar' (every bar update), 'bar_close' (only on bar close).

max_trail_distance_pct.description: Optional: maximum distance the trailing limit can move from entry/initial price. Prevents limit from trailing too far.

SizingSpec.description: Sizing instructions for how much to trade. Independent of signal logic and execution.

usd.description: Notional USD to buy/sell when type=fixed_usd.

pct.description: Percentage used by pct_equity or pct_position.

min_usd.description: Optional floor notional after pct sizing.

max_usd.description: Optional cap notional after pct sizing.

ConditionSpec.description: Composable boolean condition used for triggers and gates. Wraps atomic RegimeSpec and supports logical composition and simple temporal sequences.

sequence.description: Ordered steps: cond0 then cond1 then ... . Each step may specify within_bars.

within_bars.description: Step must occur within N bars after the previous step is satisfied.

TimeWindowSpec.description: CANONICAL time window primitive in HHMM-HHMM format (e.g., '0930-1600' for 9:30 AM to 4:00 PM). This is the single source of truth for time-of-day windows. Used by SessionSpec.window and TimeFilterSpec.time_window. All time window fields MUST reference this canonical spec.

PositionRiskSpec.description: Shared risk parameters for take profit, stop loss, and time-based exits. Used by entry cards (optional override), exit cards (often required), and overlays. For exits that require risk settings (e.g., take_profit_stop, trailing_stop, time_stop), at least one appropriate threshold must be provided. Exit-only behavior (close/reduce/reverse) is specified in ExitActionSpec, not here.

tp_pct.description: Take profit in % from entry price (e.g., 5 = +5% move from entry price).

sl_pct.description: Stop loss in % from entry price (e.g., 2 = -2% move from entry price).

tp_rr.description: Take profit as risk-reward ratio (e.g., 2.0 = TP at 2× the stop loss distance). If sl_atr=1.5, then tp_rr=2.0 means TP at 3.0 ATR from entry.

sl_atr.description: Stop loss at N × ATR from entry (ATR computed over strategy timeframe). Common values: 1.5-2.0 for normal volatility, 2.5-3.0 for wider stops.

time_stop_bars.description: Time-based exit: close position after N bars regardless of P&L. Used by exit.time_stop when event.time_elapsed=true. Value is in BARS (not days); effective duration = tf × bars.

tf.description: Timeframe for the strategy. Optional for event-driven entries (e.g., entry.gap_play, entry.event_followthrough) where timing is driven by the event.

symbol.description: Trading symbol (e.g., 'BTC-USD', 'AAPL'). Required for MVP: single-asset trading.

EntryActionSpec.description: Entry action specification. Defines direction and optional throttling/cooldown controls.

execution.description: Optional execution instructions (e.g., limit vs market). Backward compatible: omit to use engine defaults.

sizing.description: Optional explicit sizing instructions. If omitted, engine/card-level defaults apply.

cooldown_bars.description: Optional: minimum bars between consecutive entries (throttling). Set to 0 or omit to disable.

max_entries_per_day.description: Optional: maximum number of entries per day (daily cap). Set to 0 or omit to disable.

execution.description: Optional execution instructions for the exit leg (e.g., exit with limit).

sizing.description: Optional explicit sizing/scaling instructions for the exit. If omitted, falls back to size_frac or engine defaults.

time_window.description: Time-of-day window for filtering. References canonical TimeWindowSpec.

days_of_month.description: Days of the month (1-31) to allow/block

target_ids.description: Optional: specific card instance IDs to target (e.g., ['card_abc123', 'card_def456']). These are card IDs from cards attached to the strategy, NOT archetype type IDs. Use target_roles or target_tags for broader targeting. If omitted, targets all cards matching target_roles/target_tags.

Optional: specific card instance IDs to target (e.g., ['card_abc123', 'card_def456']). These are card IDs from cards attached to the strategy, NOT archetype type IDs. Use target_roles or target_tags for broader targeting. If omitted, targets all cards matching target_roles/target_tags.
